text: Even from documentation it's not clear to me where do I get `Code`  from ?

Hello,

I was creating a resource centre using HubSpot's blog functionality.
Each resource/article should redirect to a HubSpot landing page; to do this I created a custom module inside my resources to handle the metadata. ( the redirection url, the name of the button etc... )


It works well and I can retrieve this information quite easily using the widgets code: {{tag_<http://post.widgets.management/|post.widgets.management>.body.button_label}}




However my url cannot be retrieved and is always equal to "null" if my url type is "content" rather than "external"


Have you already experienced the problem?
hey <@U02M9GZTEGH>. biggest pain point for me is lack of support for alternate attributes, like `rel=something` that would trigger various javascript events
This is a pain point you experience when you try to use the native CTA builder <@U02PDLZTRPX>?
Great, thanks! I appreciate you weighing in.

anytime. one other thing - minor.
The inline CSS for each button gets loaded pretty late in the post DOM processing, so if you are on a bad cell connection, you see a delay in the styles applying.

I don't have a solution to your problem but was interested to hear how you were able to do the resource page.  We are trying to do the same thing by pulling the data into an application from HubSpot blog.  Do you have some guidance or can point me in the direction to achieve this?
We have a private app set up but are unsure of which scopes to use and how to get data from a specific page.  Our application uses C# too.
We are also looking into the same issue. Thanks!
